headline: Moist Chocolate Muffins
description: Chocolate muffins made with cocoa and chocolate chips are full of chocolaty goodness! A little plain yogurt in the batter makes them super moist.

video.description: Chocolate muffins studded with chocolate chips.
video.name: Moist Chocolate Muffins

name: Moist Chocolate Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 12 muffin cups with paper muffin liners.
Combine flour, sugar, 3/4 cup chocolate chips, cocoa powder, and baking soda in a large bowl.
Whisk yogurt, milk, oil, egg, and vanilla in separate bowl until smooth.
Pour yogurt mixture into the chocolate mixture and stir until batter is just blended.
Fill prepared muffin cups 3/4 full and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup chocolate chips.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

review.reviewBody: I almost forgot to add the oil! Sheesh! But... I made these for my husband as a Valentine's surprise since we haven't had ANY sweets in the house for quite some time! I only used half the sugar, half coconut oil, and half avocado oil. They made 18 smaller muffins. They weren't as fresh after the first day, so I probably will not make them again.
I liked it, it was very moist really tasty, anyone who this review this is your calling to make this really tasty treat!
Tried this recipe with Culina plain & simple dairy free yogurt and it turned out ok.
It was very easy to follow and muffin came out beautifully.
I've made this a few times now and it's one of my favorite muffin recipes. They turn out wonderful with or without the chocolate chips, big or small muffin cups, always moist and yummy!

This was wonderful .. I did it exatly how the video and the commands were.. It came out very good.. Was very happy to make a recipe in 45mins .. Thank you soo much @allrecipes for teaching and helping us make the recipe !! Bye !
I used gluten free cup for cup flour. These turned out amazing. I did make 18 standard sized muffins and needed to cook them for an additional 7 minutes.
The best recipe for chocolate muffins - supetmoist and tasty.
Wonderful!!
Only addition I made to the recipe was to add 1 tsp of baking powder. Otherwise, I followed it exactly. Muffins were moist and very tasty.
They're not all that, I made some last night, I ate one and my wife had one. They are not as good as I expected.

Delicious. I made by the recipe, but did add some salt after recommendations in the reviews section. Lovely, moist, chocolatey muffins! The batter is quite thick. Keep an eye on them in the last few minutes, all ovens are different so Iâ€™d say those with dry muffins may have unintentionally over baked their muffins while following the recipe (my oven took longer though) I watched them closely, pulled them out the moment they were JUST done and let them sit for the 10 minutes before removing from the tin.
Excellent, Milk was replaced with water. Came out very fluffy and light. Loved it. ðŸ˜‡

Bored at home with Covid. I had a vanilla yogurt in the fridge and thought what can I make? Muffins!!! Looked up the recipe and only change was the vanilla yogurt. I did get exited and even though I had separate bowls ready for mixing, I wound up putting them together. I made 12 of the most beautiful muffins and they were delicious. Not overly sweet. Great internet find!
Great

Made this several times now and it is awesome. Always use coconut oil instead of Vegetable oil. Just make sure eggs yogurt and milk is at room temp. Today we are adding 1/4 cup fresh squeezed orange juice and a Terry's dark chocolate orange crumbled instead of chocolate chips.
Loved it. I didn't have chocolate chips so I left them out
i like the taste but they are not soft and fluffy.the bottoms are kinda hard and chewy. followed recipe baked at 400 degrees for 20 minutes used regular size cupcake cups

Before the made this recipe I read a initial concerns with the video and the written recipe measurements not being the same, but since the video didnâ€™t give exact measurements I decided to follow the recipe. The end result of the batter looked nothing like the videos, it was more like the consistency of a cake batter. I figured cupcakes arenâ€™t the worst when your aiming for muffins, but after baking the top sunk in. I still didnâ€™t want to judge them to harshly, so I waited for them to cool and tried them, and they tasted pretty good! I have to admit that I am a novice baker, so this could have all been because of something I did. I will try again, but not with this recipe.
I made these today and they were really moist and tasty. I didnâ€™t have yogurt so I substituted sour cream. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. They were moist and soft and delicious.

Followed the recipe to a T but theyâ€™re just nasty. The texture isnâ€™t soft or gooey and the overall flavor is just gross and plain. Wish I hadnâ€™t wasted my Ghirardelli chocolate chips in theseðŸ¤¢

The recipe was easy to put together but baking for 20 minutes at 400 degrees is way too hot and too long IMO. This recipe made 19 regular sized muffins. I turned my oven down to 375 for the second batch and even at the lower temp they came out a little dry. If I make them again, I will bake them at 350 and check for doneness between 15-20 minutes.
Loved. Itâ€™s super easy to make. Mine were a bit flat though but the taste and moistness made it up for that!
They came out awful!! I followed this recipe EXACTLY and they were the worst muffins ive ever had.

I wanted to like this recipe, the batter was good and I used a lot of valuable ingredients. I made them for my sons after school snack and also a snack for his school lunch. Unfortunately the temp was way too high, I wish I would have made 
the decision to turn it down when I thought of it. My muffins were burnt on the bottom and the chocolate chips were hard and burnt throughout. Now Iâ€™m an avid baker. If I made these again I would maybe cook them at 350-375. Wayyyy to hot. Fortunately I was able to pick out some that werenâ€™t so bad for my sons after school snack

Very good! My family loved em. 
I made some changes. 
1) replaced yogurt with sour cream 
2) I used 1.5 instead of 1 cup of sour cream 
3) I added about 1/4 more sugar 
4) I added 1/2 c water 
Iâ€™d recommend adding about 1/2 cup of sugar to this recipe; it was a little bland. But, I didnâ€™t use chocolate chips. 
Overall, very good. They were a tad bit dry, but tasty.

I made these muffins except I adjusted it for 18 muffins. In the video, she uses a 12 count muffin pan.. They weren't moist or sweet! They were spongy! They were disgusting! I followed the recipe as it was written except adjusted the amount of muffins, which adjusted the amount of ingredients. The video doesn't match the recipe as it is written. Wont EVER make again!
Good with white or semisweet chips. Moist, tender crumb yet hold together well. This recipe made 12 heaping standard-sized muffins.

Both kidsâ€”separately, not knowing the other said this, tooâ€”mentioned that these were okay but tasted like someone tried to make a healthy muffin. They ate them with the enthusiasm they eat their government provided, mass-produced , sneak-in-nutrition school cafeteria chocolate muffins.
i made it 3 times and all three times they were disguting. wont be making them again.
Super awesome muffins! This recipe is superb! For first time muffin Baker like myself, I feel like a pro with this recipe. Thank u so much for sharing!

My husband loves double chocolate cookies, muffins, etc. so I had to try this recipe. I asked him what he thought, and he gave me a thumbs down. I actually baked them at 375 degrees for the same time because I have no recipes for bake at that high of a degree. They were dry and even some of the tops were dark brown. I will be freezing the muffins and making a Zombie Burger milk shake out of them (mixing ice cream with cake).

i swapped the sugar for monk fruit zero calorie sugar, they STILL came out with a rich chocolate taste. if i had used regular sugar iâ€™m sure these would be amazing. i did include mini chocolate chips, and i followed megan sargentâ€™s suggestions as well. definitely will make again.

Nice recipe, I used an extra .5 cup of yogurt instead of the .5 cup milk. They turned out nice and soft. Just a bit of salt would make it even better. I used a smallish muffin tin size and got almost 2 dozen out of the recipe!
Too simple to cook and it turned out very moist. My son and my husband loved it! This Will be in my top list

Not as moist and fluffy as I expected, but still very tasty. I didn't have chocolate chips the first time I made it, so I just crushed up some chocolate bars. Worked the same. Make sure to take out of the oven right away, they burn very easily.
So good!! I also found the recommendation to cook at 400 for first 5 minutes made them perfectly cooked!
Too dry and spongey. I appreciate trying to make a muffin recipe without any butter, but the end result was cake-like spongey without the soft crumbles you expect from a muffin.
It was so easy to make and so moist.
it actually made about twenty muffins haha

Great recipie. Like others, I had to change it up a bit using what I had on hand. I substituted sour cream for the yoghurt and mixed in white chocolate chips. It needed a couple pinches of salt. I also turned the heat back to 350 after 10 min at 400. That set up the overflowing tops. I let the muffins cook a little longer until a toothpick came up clean. I'd add a little more chocolate chips next time.

Absolutely love this recipe!!!
Reminded me of my mums muffins as a kid. Also love that these don't stick to the side of paper trays.

The perfect chocolate muffin I have been looking for. I replaced 1/4 cup oil with 1/4 cup applesauce, and added 1/2 tsp. cinnamon, 1/2 tsp. instant coffee granules & 1/2 tsp. salt, after reading some of the reviews. The result was a lower fat, but moist and chocolaty muffin with rich flavor. The recipe made 18 muffins.

I made these deliciously, moist, muffins last night! I put a few in my husband's lunch this morning, he's going to love them, and wish that I'd put more in! I'm embarrassed to say, that I did forget to put in the 3/4 cup of chocolate chips! (I only put in the 1/4 cup of chips that was meant to be added to the top before cooking.) They still turned out great! After muffins cooled a bit I added a little sprinkle of powdered sugar. Will I make these again? You bet! But next time I will remember to add all of the chips!
The dough did not have enough liquid. I needed to add more, and the final result in about 20 minutes was very dry muffins.

I followed the directions exactly. When adding the oil, I thought that a half cup was too much, but I trusted the directions. I should have trusted my gut because these muffins taste like oil and chocolate. I'm not sure how this has so many high stars unless people changed the recipe, knowing the oil was way too much.
My kids love it so much.
Super good! But the recipe is missing salt.
Made the muffins exactly like the recipe. They were extremely dry.

I have made these muffins so many times I can't count... it is a family favorite for sure. These are the best! The only change I make is to add 3/4 to 1 teaspoon of salt to the recipe - makes a world of difference in flavor! My daughter even requested these as her birthday treat instead of cake - they are THAT good!

I made these muffins with sour cream instead of yogurt and added a little salt. They were amazing! So moist and chocolately. I shared some with my mom and her husband and they couldnâ€™t believe how delicious they were. I will definitely be making these again.
I loved it

Made an account just for this review. Changed the recipe like this bc of comments, added a tablespoon of milk and sugar more & 1/4 cup more chocolate chips (I doubled the recipe, so 1/2 more). Changed plain yogurt to strawberry yogurt (bc thats all I had) and it was so good. Chocolate muffins with a slight hint of strawberry! Also baked at 350 for 20min, my muffins were between mini muffins and store bought muffins, like at walmart.
Mine turned out dry and crumbly. I used half Greek yogurt half sour cream and baked them for only 15 minutes but they were not moist at all.
I followed all except i used blueberry and strawberry flavored yogurt. Still tasted good.
Well one thing is for sure, 20 minutes is far to long to cook! Mine burned so unfortunately I cannot give a full review, because i donâ€™t know how they would taste.
Absolutely blown away by these! Super easy to make and it delivers what it promises, simply moist and scrumptious.
I used our homemade yogurt from the Instant pot and these turned out super good. Every one in our family loves them!
These muffins are delicious I made them with my daughter and they were gone within a week

Theses muffins were really good , followed recipe just added a little salt and used vanilla yogurt. Definitely need to under bake these or they will be dry!!! Mine only took about 12 min in a gas oven.

These were great and this is a very flexible recipe. With quarantine I didn't have yogurt or milk. I used applesauce in place of the yogurt and water in place of the milk. I added 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder in case there wasn't enough acid to make the muffins rise. They came out great. They are actually a cupcake but whatever the name they are good! Next time I'll add some toasted nuts.

These are delish! I made these the other day for family and they loved it. They said it looked and tasted like fresh bakery muffins. I had one problem though, but it was on me. I didnâ€™t have anough chocolate chips, and couldnâ€™t go out and but some so they were a little less chocolatey, but again, that was on me. I would definitely make these again and with enough chocolate chips!
Followed the recipe exactly how it is. They came out beau delicious. Not too sweet, moist and so yummy. Thanks for sharing!!
They weren't very chocolaty... In the future, I would mix additional cooca powder with the yogurt mix...
I used applesauce in place of the vegetable oil and I have to say these muffins are delicious! It was moist and chocolatey without being greasy. I will definitely make these again!
This was my first time baking! The recipe is easy to follow and they tasted fabulous. I substituted plain yogurt for Greek and there was no problem at all. Definitely going to make these again!
I loved it! So fluffy!
I halted the ingredients and it gave me 8 cupcakes. I didnâ€™t have enough chocolate chips so I just sprinkled a bit on top. My kids loved it!
Muffins were a little bland for me so Iâ€™m going to add more chocolate chips and a bit more sugar next time.
I specifically wanted a chocolaty, moist muffin recipe. These muffins were neither chocolaty nor moist. Very bland and dry. Super disappointed!
These were awesome!!
20 minutes at 400 was too long. They were overdone. I think 20 at 350 would have been better. I would have liked a deeper chocolate flavor.

Really moist with just enough chocolate chips!! I actually did not sprinkle tops with extra chocoate chips before baking. They turned out really well. Made 12 average sized muffins. Went well with a nice espresso.

During this time of social distancing, I was craving chocolate and this did the trick! Although, I did some additions.... A quarter cup of room temp dark roast coffee and a dollup of Nutella in the middle. Moist and chocolaty!
These are okay. Made as written except I baked them at 375 degrees and added a pinch of salt.
Followed recipe to the letter but muffins collapse once cool.

Used 50/50 whole wheat/oat flour, 1/2 cup melted butter instead of oil,cut sugar to 1/2 cup and used strawberry yogurt.
Delicious !!!!
Came out so tasty! Read the reviews and added instant coffee for added flavor and a scoop of yogurt for moisture.
These do not need to cook 20 minutes. 18 should suffice. The recipe is delicious and not overly sweet.
i will make it again. i used pediasure vanilla in place of milk. everything else is awesome.
all i can really taste is yogurt.. maybe add a little less? and add salt to the recipe?

I made it and only had to make 2 modifications. I didn't have any plain yogurt so I used sour cream and I used 2 eggs instead of one. The muffins turned out really well! Very moist and very delicious.

Good, light and fluffy, crispy on top. Missing something. I think I would use coffee next time instead of milk, or add instant coffee to the milk to add a little more depth, and maybe a little brown sugar. Made 12 large muffins.
put it in for 17 minutes
Mine came very dry like a sponge, and didnâ€™t taste good. Iâ€™m not going to follow this recipe again, I will stick with my old recipe!
Excellent! Made them with my chocolate crazy granddaughter. She loved them.
I made it and I ate it and I enjoyed my life.
This is my go-to muffin recipe! The yoghurt really makes a difference
They are moist, but thatâ€™s the only highlight.

Followed the recipe and surprised I didnâ€™t like them more. Actually, my family didnâ€™t either. Needs more sugar, itâ€™s just not sweet enough. Makes a very pretty muffin though. If you are not a sweet tooth but love chocolate this is the recipe for you.
Delicious just the way they are. I didnâ€™t change anything! ??Yummy!!

This recipe is a keeper! Super moist and delicious and also easy to modify. I followed exactly the recipe when I tried it for the first time. And this second time I made half flour and half oatmeal and I can't tell the difference in taste and texture. It definitely will be added to my recipe compilation. Thank you for sharing this yummy recipe!

I cut the sugar in half as suggested by others and was glad I did. Unfortunately, I did not have plain yogurt so I subbed sour cream. I used a mix of espresso chips, caramel bites and chocolate chips. They worked great as mini muffins - 5 minutes, rotate and then another 5 minutes.
These are great!! I followed it exactly except I only used half the oil and added raw almonds for half of the batch. This made 12 muffins and 9 mini bundts.
very moist and delicious. I added a pinch of salt and they were perfect.
I doubled the recipie, added more chocolate drinking mix, honey and brown sugar and used 3 eggs. Added large flake oats too.

I really love this recipe! works great, easy to make, and tastes excellent! my kids almost ate all the muffins in less than a day. Very chocolatey so if 1/2 cup cocoa is too rich, cut it down to 1/4. it's still really good, but much less of a chocolate punch in the mouth lol.
the time was wrong mine came hard like a rock and I followed the recipe exactly
These didnâ€™t seem that moist but were still delicious!
